body.name: Food and Mess Catcher - Compatible with IKEA Antilop High Chair - Food Catching Accessory for Highchairs - Baby & Toddler Food Mat Catcher
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 7 hrs 50 mins
features: ORIGINAL FOOD AND MESS CATCHER - Catchy is a world-first, patented food catching accessory that attaches to your child’s highchair (sold separately). It is a dream come true for messy meal times! Catchy is designed to be used for the full duration that your little human is in a highchair - from starting solids to managing their own meals.
SAVE YOUR FLOORS: As seen on Shark Tank - catches food dropped or thrown by bub, so no more ruined carpets and stained floorboards!

SAVE YOUR SANITY (AND BACK!): No more getting on your hands and knees cleaning the floors or stressing every time your child throws their food. Sit back, relax and enjoy stress-free mealtimes with your bub!

EASY TO CLEAN - Catchy is made from a durable, stain resistant, and a waterproof material. It is much easier to clean than the floors. Designed to be installed once and left in place, there is no need to remove the tray between meals, simply wipe it clean in place and it's ready for the next meal.

HIGH QUALITY - Designed to withstand whatever your little one can throw at it, Catchy can be reused meal after meal. Our highchair food catcher is made from non-toxic, BPA-free, PVC-free and food safe Polypropylene material, so you can rescue any dropped food.

ENCOURAGES HEALTHY EATING HABITS – Designed by parents for parents and backed by experts. It is important for our little humans to explore their food and make a mess when eating. Catchy supports this by creating a stress-free environment and positive mealtimes for both parents and kids.

COMPATIBLE - Unlike floor splat mats, our one time installation allows Catchy to stay on your child’s highchair between use while taking up minimal space. Due to the differences in leg designs and configurations, this food catcher is only compatible with these specific high chair models (sold separately): compatible with IKEA Antilop, 4BABY Flatfold, Mother’s Choice Breeze, BEBE Classic 2-in-1, Cosco Canteen, Baby Solutions Quadro, Aldo Mamia w. metal 4 legs, Puck Kinderstoel & Feed me Oyuncak.
body.description: Catchy is a world-first and patented food catcher that attaches to your child's high chair Designed by parents for parents - the innovative design is your dream come true for messy meal times. Our high chair food catcher is backed by experts and an essential accessory for baby-led weaning and starting solids. Waterproof, durable and easy to clean, Catchy is made from a non-toxic material so you can safely re-offer dropped food to your little human. Say goodbye to constant cleaning, back-breaking, wasted food, and ruined floors. Save your food, save your floors and save your sanity with Catchy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for BLW!
reviews.reviewText: I was hesitant about this, due to the price for what looked like a flimsy piece of plastic, but I have been so pleased! We’ve done baby-led weaning (starting with finger foods) with all our kids, which in the past meant tons of food getting tossed to the floor and wasted. But now, with the Catchy, I just scoop discarded food up and hand it right back to Baby. It catches pretty much everything, and after meals I can easily slide it right to the sink or trashcan to wipe off any leftover food that’s been squished beyond recognition. It’s easy to assemble, keeps our floor clean (especially useful in our carpeted dining room), and saves me time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It keeps our Shiba away from the baby’s food
reviews.reviewText: I got this mainly because I was annoyed when our adorable Shiba would constantly walk under the high chair looking for scraps during feedings. She can’t get under the chair anymore and there are almost no food particles that end up on the floor. Our Shiba is around 23 lbs and kind of tall for a Shiba Inu.The tray is easy to clean and the side with the black writing should be facing the floor so the side facing the baby is all white(I’d seen a review where someone had installed it upside down and was complaining about the black ink smearing onto the baby). Also, when installing it is important to do the corner tabs in alphabetical order. If you don’t it’s much harder for some reason.I use this on the boon grub high chair and it fits perfectly. Now I almost never need to wipe the floor after meals. I do recommend this item.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My husband and I bought a Stokke Tripp Trapp for our second child; our baby has officially learned the joy of dropping things for Mommy and Daddy to pick up...over and over and over again.We do not find it as joyful.Enter this "Catchy". It does exactly as promised, is easy to install on the chair, and as my baby is starting solids it will not only catch sneakily dropped toys and teethers but also food for easy clean up. It wipes up/cleans easily, is large enough to catch most dropped items that aren't flung away, and has already been a sanity saver for my husband and me. We picked this over similar competitor items as it's larger and has a better chance of catching everything.The only cons so far are price (it's a cleverly cut plastic sheet; it feels overpriced to me) and that it is not easily removable; the entire seat and backrest(s) must be removed in order to install this thing, so once it's on it is unlikely you'll be willing to take it off frequently or at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple and works so well!!
reviews.reviewText: Definitely get this if your baby is throwing food on the ground especially if you have pets. Our dog was literally camping underneath her chair waiting for her scraps. Now it all gets caught in the catchy and can finally enjoy mealtime again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I clicked buy and then thought “did I really just spend $50+ on a piece of plastic to add to the high chair?!”Thought about canceling the order because it felt sillyAfter one time of her being in her high chair, the amount of sanity this thing saved me by keeping her food and utensils off the floor and away from our dog was 1000% worth every dollar. Actually, I probably would have even paid more 😂 and that’s after one useSave yourself the sanity and just buy it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Don’t buy it
reviews.reviewText: Not worth the money at all it’s Lindsey plastic and the ink rubs off on my kiddos feet and gets everywhere I can’t get the ink to come off either. Sure it catches the food but the walls aren’t that tall our little dog can still get up there and get food out of the tray so if you have a big dog, it won’t do any good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Made it work 🤷🏻‍♀️
reviews.reviewText: I have the evenflo 4 in 1 grow with me high chair. I can’t find a single product that would fit the high chair and I didn’t want a floor one because the whole point is to keep the dogs from eating things they can’t have. I don’t want to buy a whole new high chair just to use a catcher. I am not sure why high chairs don’t just come with some sort of a catch tray because 100% of all babies throw food. Design flaw for sure.This does NOT fit the evenflo chair, BUT nothing does so I made it work. Although it looks rough, it still catches the food and that is all that matters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024

reviews.reviewText: This a gift for my grandson on christmas. It is nice and no food on the floor. It catches everything when you feed the baby. No messy floor!
My daughter likes it as it keeps the food off the floor
